com.anotherservice.rest.model

Class SecurityImpl

  • Object
    • SecurityImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISecurity

    public class SecurityImpl
extends Object
implements ISecurity
    This is the default implementation of ISecurity using the predefined model. null or empty grants are ignored. Grant names are case insensitive.

    Relies on the config variable :
    • com.anotherservice.rest.model.superadminGrantName which is the name of the super admin grant that superseeds all other grants. If such grant does not exist, do not set it or leave it empty.
    • com.anotherservice.rest.model.authParameter which is a list of possible request parameter name in which the authentication info can be found.


    The Servlet.tmp will be checked by the hasGrants(Collection) method in order to determine if temporarily given grants are present. To use this behavior, the com.anotherservice.rest.model.securityTmpGrants key should be used to store a Collection<String> that contains the name of the grants that the current requestor will be considered to have. Use this, for instance, to forward a request to a different handler that requires other grants that the current user may not have.

    Additionnally, the com.anotherservice.rest.model.securityTmpCache.* keys will be used to cache the getUser(), userId(String), hasGrants(Collection, String), and hasGrants(Collection, String, String) return values in order to speed up successive calls.
